item.title: Data Science Guides
item.description: Information about the Lasseigne Lab-hosted ‘Data Science Office Hours’ can be found in this guide The Lasseigne Lab executes most downstream omics analysis with R in RStudio and we generally recommend the same for others. Directions for downloading and installing R and RStudio, as well as vetted R programming lessons for beginners, can be found here Curated resources and tutorials for RNA-Seq analysis are found here Information about Single-Cell Transcriptomics can be found here

item.title: Teaching and Outreach
item.description: Guest speaker for MCBIOS19 Student Career Development Session; ‘Social Media for Science Careers’ slides Guest speaker for HudsonAlpha GTAC: Advanced Concepts workshop; ‘Introduction to Machine Learning with Genomic Data Applications’ slides Content Developer and instructor for the 2018 HudsonAlpha BioTrain Computational Biology Bootcamp (4 June 2018) Co-lead instructor of a Software Carpentry Workshop at the George Washington University in Washington D.C. (8-9 March 2018) on Unix shell, Git version control, and R programming.
